The name comes from Greek "kteis" (comb) and "pherō" (to carry). The main body structures are the jelly-like mass with two-cell layers. Fossil records go back to the Cambrian. The evolutionary hypotheses include the Porifera Sister Hypothesis and Ctenophora Sister Hypothesis. The examples of species are cydippids, platyctenids, and beroids. The taxonomic status is a matter of dispute. Also, mention the colloblasts for capturing prey and the fact that some are parasites.
